pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:0.4: 13. The second training rule on bad behavior
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā had been pressed by the Sangha. She then said to the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.3: “But, Venerables, you should socialize; don’t live separately.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.4: There are other nuns too in the Sangha who have such behavior and such a reputation, and who harass the Sangha of nuns and hide each other’s offenses. The Sangha says nothing to them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.5: It’s because of disrespect, contempt, intolerance, slander, and weakness that the Sangha of nuns says to you, ‘Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses. Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.6: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.7: “How could Venerable Thullanandā, after being pressed by the Sangha, say this to the nuns:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.8: ‘But, Venerables, you should socialize; don’t live separately.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.9: There are other nuns too in the Sangha … “…
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.10: Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters”’?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.11: “Is it true, monks, that after being pressed by the Sangha, the nun Thullanandā is saying this to the nuns?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.17: How can the nun Thullanandā, after being pressed by the Sangha, say this to the nuns:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.18: ‘But, Venerables, you should socialize; don’t live separately.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.19: There are other nuns too in the Sangha … “…
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.20: Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters”’?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.21: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.22: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.24: “Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.25: There are other nuns, too, in the Sangha who have such behavior, such a reputation, such notoriety, who harass the Sangha of nuns, and who hide each other’s offenses. The Sangha says nothing to them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.26: It’s because of disrespect, contempt, intolerance, slander, and weakness that the Sangha of nuns says to you, ‘Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses. Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters,’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.27: then the nuns should correct her in this way:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.29: ‘Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.30: There are other nuns too in the Sangha who have such behavior, such a reputation, such notoriety, who harass the Sangha of nuns, and who hide each other’s offenses. The Sangha says nothing to them.

Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.32: If that nun still continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.33: If she then stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.34: If not, then that nun too has committed a third-time offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.6: “Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.44: “And, monks, she should be pressed in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.45: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.46: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This nun so-and-so, after being pressed by the Sangha, says this to the nuns, “Venerables, you should socialize.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.53: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.54: And she keeps on doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.55: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should press her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.86: There are other nuns too in the Sangha who have such behavior, such a reputation, such notoriety, who harass the Sangha of nuns, and who hide each other’s offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.87: The Sangha says nothing to them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.91: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.92: And she keeps on doing it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.93: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.94: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.95: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.96: For the second time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.97: For the third time I speak on this matter …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.98: This nun so-and-so has been pressed by the Sangha to make her stop.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.99: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.100: After the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.101: After each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.102: When the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.103: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.105: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.107: there is an offense when she has been pressed for the third time, not as soon as the misconduct has been committed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.109: she is sent away from the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.111: only the Sangha gives one a trial period for that offense, sends one back to the beginning, and rehabilitates one—not several nuns, not an individual nun. Therefore it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.112: This is the name and designation of this class of offense. Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.113: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as legitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.114: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.115: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.116: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.117: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.118: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as illegitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.120: if she has not been pressed;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.123: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.124: The thirteenth offense entailing suspension is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.126: “Venerables, the seventeen rules on suspension have been recited,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.127: nine being immediate offenses, eight after the third announcement.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.128: If a nun commits any one of them, she must undertake a trial period of a half-month toward both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.129: When this is completed, she is to be rehabilitated wherever there is a sangha of at least twenty nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.130: If that nun is rehabilitated by a sangha of nuns of even one less than twenty,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.131: that nun is not rehabilitated and those nuns are at fault. This is proper procedure.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.132: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.138: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.139: The group of seventeen is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.140: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension in the nuns’ analysis is finished.
